Key Match Events: Brooklyn Nets led by seven with just over four minutes remaining in the contest.
Brooklyn Nets lost to the Cleveland Cavaliers 105-100.
Dennis Schröder played 37 minutes and scored 22 points with five assists.
Post-Match Reflections: Brooklyn Nets head coach Jordi Fernandez took responsibility for the loss, stating it was his fault for not managing player substitutions effectively.
Fernandez acknowledged running Dennis Schröder for 12 minutes in the fourth quarter without a break, which affected execution and defense.
Fernandez also mentioned not giving Cam Thomas breaks, which impacted the team's performance at the end of the game.
